subject: College Athletics
lead_paragraph: The N.C.A.A. yesterday revoked 2004 and 2005 national track and field titles from Arkansas for violations involving the star sprinter Tyson Gay and a former assistant.Arkansas had reported violations committed by the former assistant Lance Brauman, who was convicted last year of embezzlement, theft and mail fraud from his time at Barton County Community College in Kansas. Brauman’s mail-fraud indictment identified Gay, who transferred to Arkansas from Barton County with help from Brauman.
